page.title: 12Church continued
page.content: The main window records Queen Victoria's 60 year long reign with the dates 1837 and 1897 etched in the glass. The organ is about 80 years old and is sited in the gallery where the choir sits and sings on Sundays. The Sunday School is held above the village post office. The grave stones are made of Portland stone. The graveyard is now full so there are no more burials here. In 1984 the church interior was rebuilt and new chairs replaced the old pews. They have even had a bulldozer in the church!
